full_text: AMERICAN CONSULATE Tijuana, B.C. Mexico Apartado Postal Post Office Box 1358 Tijuana, B. C., Mexico San Ysidro, California 92073. TO: Date You are hereby advised that this office considers you preliminarily ineligible to receive a visa under the provisions of Section 212(a)(15) of the Immigration and Nationality Act. * This office is, however, willing to give further consideration to your case if a person or organization interested in your admission into the United States posts a public charge bond with the nearest Office of the United States Im- migration and Naturalization Service in the amount of . This bond should be posted in your name and in the name(s) of the following member (s) of your family: In obtaining this bond your sponsor must file with the Immigration and Naturalization Service nearest his place of residence Form I-352 which requires the following information: 1. Name of each alien in whose behalf bond is required, spelled in accordance with his usage. 2. Age of alien (if more than one alien is to benefit from the bond, the ages of all should be given). 3. Country of birth of each alien. 4. Anticipated date and port of arrival. It is suggested that you send this letter to the person prepared to post the bond and request him to present it to the Immigration and Naturalization Service his place of residence, in order that this office may be appropriately advised when the bond has been posted. * Section 21 2(a)(15) of the Immigration and Nationality Act relates to: "Aliens who, in the opinion the consular officer at the time of applicati for Visa, or ta the optilling of the Attorney Ceneral at the time of application for admission, are likely at any time to become public charges. (Spanish on reverse side) (Espanol a la vuelta)
